SubSections.Title: Notes
SubSections.Content: For creating NPCs, don't overrely on any of the below stats and boons. Instead, use them as a rough guideline to quickly improvise enemies on the spot. Likewise, avoid defining a list of abilities, and instead decide thematically on 1 or 2 weapons, and use the corresponding techniques. If an NPC is stronger than usual, giving it access to 1 or 2 masteries might help making the fight more unique.

SubSections.Title: Health And Shield
SubSections.Content: The idea is not to fight to the death. Instead, once shield is broken, most will run away, because they don't wanna risk death, nor any serious injuries that might be expensive to heal. Likewise, try scaling the NPCs so that for the players, it might be worth letting some enemies go, rather than continuing the fight to the death, which might put both in a bad situation.

SubSections.Title: Long Combats
SubSections.Content: The system is designed to excel at long combats, keeping them tactically interesting and engaging for a long time without much preparation or improvisation at the GM's side. It is recommended to make easy combats last 3-6 rounds, and difficult combats 9-15 rounds. To achieve this, health and shield need to be sufficiently high.

SubSections.Title: Addendum
SubSections.Content: Both max health and base shield should be doubled for NPCs that aren't summons.
